Graphs

June 2012

Facebook builds the social graph, Google the knowledge graph, Twitter the interest graph, Linkedin your professional graph, Amazon you taste graph.

A graph? It’s nothing more than your offline habits and thoughts made digital.

These services are mapping you as a digital object on the information universe called internet.

That’s the point, the quantified self. You’ll be measurable, taggable, computable, programmable.

And yes that’s the knowledge economy: not rising people by making them know but knowing everything about them.

What a twist darling!

This story is about quantification. With focus on privacy, knowledge.
Gap
Letting Go
